alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 13 at 5:00PM CDT until June 13 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Wichita County in west central Kansas... Greeley County in west central Kansas... * Until 430 PM MDT/530 PM CDT/. * At 400 PM MDT/500 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 14 miles northeast of Horace to 6 miles northeast of Tribune to 7 miles southeast of Towner, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Wichita and Greeley Counties, including the following locations... Selkirk. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
